title: CBT Thought Record
description: Learn to identify and analyze your thoughts using a structured thought record

questions.prompt: Describe a recent situation that triggered uncomfortable emotions:
questions.placeholder: Example: During a team meeting, my suggestion was rejected...

questions.prompt: What was your primary emotion in this situation?
Rate the intensity of your emotion (1-10):
What thoughts went through your mind in this situation?
questions.placeholder: Example: Everyone thinks my ideas are stupid. I shouldn't speak up anymore.

questions.prompt: Did you notice any distorted thinking patterns in your thoughts?
options: Overgeneralization (applying one experience to all situations)

questions.placeholder: Example: My idea was rejected and someone sighed when I was speaking.
Example: People have praised my ideas in the past. The team was stressed about the deadline.

questions.prompt: What would you tell a friend who had the same thoughts in this situation?
questions.placeholder: Example: One rejected idea doesn't mean all your ideas are bad. The rejection wasn't personal.

questions.prompt: Write a more balanced alternative thought:
questions.placeholder: Example: My idea wasn't right for this particular project, but that doesn't mean I don't have valuable contributions.

questions.prompt: After writing your balanced thought, rate your emotion again (1-10):
